name: Lemon-Garlic Turkey Skillet with Roasted Zucchini over Cauli Rice
description: Bright, herb-garlic turkey served with oven-roasted zucchini and fluffy cauliflower rice. A quick, keto-friendly family plate with mild flavors.
prep_steps: Trim and cut zucchini into half-moons, 1 cm thick.
cook_steps: Roast zucchini: Toss zucchini with 1 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt and black pepper on a baking tray. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Start turkey: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add onions and cook 2–3 minutes until softened.
Add turkey: Crumble in turkey and cook 5–7 minutes, breaking up, until no longer pink.
Season turkey: Stir in garlic, lemon zest, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Cook 1–2 minutes until fragrant. Squeeze in half the lemon, then stir in parsley. Turn heat low to keep warm.
Warm cauli rice: In a separate skillet over medium heat, add cauliflower rice with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Cook 3–4 minutes, stirring, until hot and steamy.
Finish and serve: Plate cauliflower rice, top with turkey, add roasted zucchini on the side. Serve with remaining lemon wedges for extra brightness.
instructions: Trim and cut zucchini into half-moons, 1 cm thick.
Roast zucchini: Toss zucchini with 1 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt and black pepper on a baking tray. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Start turkey: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add onions and cook 2–3 minutes until softened.
Add turkey: Crumble in turkey and cook 5–7 minutes, breaking up, until no longer pink.
Season turkey: Stir in garlic, lemon zest, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Cook 1–2 minutes until fragrant. Squeeze in half the lemon, then stir in parsley. Turn heat low to keep warm.
Warm cauli rice: In a separate skillet over medium heat, add cauliflower rice with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Cook 3–4 minutes, stirring, until hot and steamy.
Finish and serve: Plate cauliflower rice, top with turkey, add roasted zucchini on the side. Serve with remaining lemon wedges for extra brightness.
